features.name: Position Deletes
features.description: Delete rows by tracking their file and position offsets, enabling efficient row-level deletes without rewriting entire data files

features.name: Equality Deletes
features.description: Delete rows matching equality predicates without rewriting data files, using delete files that specify column values to match

features.name: Merge-on-Read
features.description: Write strategy that records changes as delete files merged at read time, offering faster writes at the cost of slower reads

features.name: Copy-on-Write
features.description: Write strategy that rewrites affected data files on each update or delete, providing fast reads but slower writes

features.name: Schema Evolution
features.description: Add, drop, rename, reorder columns or change column types without rewriting existing data files

features.name: Column Default Values
features.description: Define default values for columns that apply when new data is written without specifying a value for that column

features.name: Nanosecond Timestamps
features.description: Support for nanosecond-precision timestamp and timestamptz types, enabling higher precision time tracking

features.name: Hidden Partitioning
features.description: Partition data using transforms (year, month, day, hour, bucket, truncate) without exposing partition columns to users

features.name: Partition Evolution
features.description: Change the partitioning scheme of a table without rewriting existing data, allowing new data to use the updated scheme

features.name: Multi-Argument Transforms
features.description: Partition transforms that accept multiple arguments, enabling more flexible partitioning strategies

features.name: Time Travel / Snapshots
features.description: Query historical versions of a table using snapshot IDs or timestamps to access data as it existed at a point in time

features.name: Table Maintenance
features.description: Operations to optimize table storage including compaction, snapshot expiry, orphan file removal, and rewriting manifests

features.name: Branching & Tagging
features.description: Create named branches and tags on table snapshots for isolation, testing, and reproducible queries

features.name: Read Support
features.description: Ability to read data from Iceberg tables including scan planning, predicate pushdown, and column projection

features.name: Write (INSERT)
features.description: Ability to insert new data into Iceberg tables using INSERT INTO or append operations

features.name: Write (MERGE/UPDATE/DELETE)
features.description: Ability to perform row-level mutations including MERGE INTO, UPDATE, and DELETE operations

features.name: Catalog Integration
features.description: Integration with one or more Iceberg catalog implementations for table metadata management

features.name: Hive Metastore
features.description: Apache Hive Metastore catalog implementation for managing Iceberg table metadata using the Hive Thrift protocol

features.name: AWS Glue Catalog
features.description: AWS Glue Data Catalog as an Iceberg catalog, providing serverless metadata management integrated with AWS analytics services

features.name: REST Catalog
features.description: Vendor-neutral REST API-based catalog specification for managing Iceberg table metadata over HTTP

features.name: Nessie
features.description: Project Nessie catalog providing Git-like versioning, branching, and tagging for Iceberg table metadata

features.name: Polaris
features.description: Apache Polaris (incubating) open-source catalog service implementing the Iceberg REST Catalog API with fine-grained access control

features.name: Unity Catalog
features.description: Databricks Unity Catalog providing unified governance for data and AI assets, with Iceberg REST Catalog API support

features.name: Hadoop Catalog
features.description: File-system based catalog that stores Iceberg metadata directly on HDFS or compatible storage without an external service

features.name: JDBC Catalog
features.description: JDBC-based catalog that stores Iceberg table metadata in a relational database such as PostgreSQL or MySQL

features.name: Variant Type
features.description: Semi-structured data type that stores JSON-like data in a compact binary format with efficient field access without parsing

features.name: Shredded Variant
features.description: Optimization for Variant type that shreds frequently accessed fields into separate columns for faster queries while keeping the full variant

features.name: Geometry / Geo Types
features.description: Geospatial data types for storing points, lines, polygons and other geometry objects natively in Iceberg tables

features.name: Vector / Embedding Type
features.description: Fixed-length float array type for storing ML embeddings and vectors, enabling similarity search and AI workloads on Iceberg tables

features.name: Change Data Capture (CDC)
features.description: Native support for capturing and replaying row-level changes (inserts, updates, deletes) as a stream from Iceberg tables

features.name: Lineage Tracking
features.description: Metadata-level tracking of data provenance and transformations, enabling end-to-end data lineage across Iceberg tables
